body_html:
Is CUDA_LAUNCH_BLOCKING set by any chance? It is incompatible with nccl. What's happening in 2 is expected (except the hang part) - nccl kernels have to be submitted to all the devices, so kernel is submitted to the first device, it goes into 100% utilization, then kernel is submitted to the 2nd device, then nccl has to realize that the full grid is launched, run reduction and exit.
Try export NCCL_DEBUG=INFO and may be you'll see something?

body:
Is CUDA_LAUNCH_BLOCKING set by any chance? It is incompatible with nccl. What's happening in 2 is expected (except the hang part) - nccl kernels have to be submitted to all the devices, so kernel is submitted to the first device, it goes into 100% utilization, then kernel is submitted to the 2nd device, then nccl has to realize that the full grid is launched, run reduction and exit. 
Try ```export NCCL_DEBUG=INFO``` and may be you'll see something?
